abstract: The Supreme Court was asked to review a 2006 federal fraud racketeering conviction against the tobacco industry.
snippet: The Supreme Court was asked to review a 2006 federal fraud racketeering conviction against the tobacco industry.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court on Friday to review a 2006 federal fraud racketeering conviction against the tobacco industry and to authorize the district judge in the case to require tobacco companies to give up as much as $280 billion in “ill-gotten gains.”

headline.main: U.S. Asks Justices to Review Tobacco Company Ruling
headline.print_headline: U.S. Asks Justices to Review Tobacco Company Ruling
